questions.question: Never ……………………. seen so much food.
questions.description: When a sentence begins with a negative expression, the inverted word order is used.

questions.question: I look forward to …………………… from you.
questions.description: The ing form is used after look forward to.

questions.question: The faster you run, ………………………. you get tired.
questions.description: In both clauses, we use the structure the + comparative + clause.

questions.question: ………………….. our best efforts, we could not win the contract.
questions.description: You can use despite or in spite of here.

questions.question: It is time you ………………….. married.
questions.description: The simple past is used with a present or future meaning after it is time.

questions.question: I am extremely close to ………………………… friends I have.
questions.description: The few means not many but all of them.

questions.question: Having …………………… the cats, she went to work.
She speaks …………………………. she knows everything.
questions.description: Either as if or as though is possible here.

questions.question: ……………………….. I didn’t know his address, I couldn’t write to him.
questions.description: As gives the reason so shows the effect.

questions.question: You …………………….. start spending more wisely.
questions.description: Had better is used to give strong advice.

questions.question: I would rather you ……………………. seeing her.
questions.description: A simple past is used after would rather to refer to the present or future.

questions.question: He worked …………………….. hard that he fell ill.
questions.description: Use so before an adjective and such before adjective + noun.
